I didn't bowl as I just wanted to try out the drinks and bear and let me tell you, the food is amazing. I ordered the fish and chips as well as the tavern burger. The food took about 15 min to come out but when it did... MY GOD, WAS THAT BURGER GOOD. If you go def. get the tavern burger as is. By the time I finished it I was too full to eat the fish so I got it to go. It was good but man, that burger.

I would say the service is 7 out of 10.
The mood is a 9 out of 10.
The drinks were fine 8 out of 10.
Food (mainly just that burger) 10 out of 10.

I think I have found my new fav. burger.

Go HUNGRY! I've been here a few times and always had a great experience. Well worth The price. The salad bar is delish. Service is impeccable. The food is delicious, love the palenta! I will definitely go back. I had a great dinning experienced overall.

1st time here today and the food was fantastic! The passion fruit dressing was to die for. I had the Cubano Sandwich and wife had a fried plantain sandwich. The beef and veg soup was so good with the cilantro they put in. Coming back for sure!!

Hi there, my name is Nicolle Haver, and I have been going to canyon falls for about a year now for color and extensions by The fabulous Kat! My hair wasn't in the best shape when I started going to her, but since my hair has never been blonder or healthier!! She is so kind and passionate about what she does, and it really shows in her results! Absolutely recommend her, but make sure to pre book, because the girl gets busy!

STAPLE in my dessert. what a way to end a dinner.
The bread pudding was excellent until I bite in something hard, which was a staple!

I can't believe the waiter told me it was an accident and that it was a bad luck thing.
WHAT?   There were no excuse or whatsoever.
He didn't even offer to have my dessert waived or anything.
I had to ask him on receiving the check.
So, on a 49$ menu, he took off a HUGE 4$ after taxes..
He might as well keep it. ......

I almost swallowed the f* staple !


So Food were ok. Degustation menu at 49$ is subpar for most of the dishes. 

The dessert were good, the entrees were less.
positive thing: Piglet were cooked perfectly. but at 49$ for one dish with extremely small portions is not worth it.

Magret de canard is not cooked very well. It's supposed to be ros, but was served medium rare ..when i told the waiter that it was raw, he told me it was the way it's recommended. NO. it's ros (or pink)


" Duck meat is at its best when served pink "

http://www.canardsdulacbrome.com/en/produits/4_poitrine_de_canard_desossee/


It focuses on Quebec's food, we can identify quality products but it was poorly executed : magret de canard was undercooked, making it chewy.
Veal was undercooked as demanded.

Service is just as bad.

Pricey for what it is.

Not returning that's for sure.

Oh by the way. THANKS SACH (waiter).


Please, go somewhere else.

Tirsa is an absolute artist! I've followed her for years because she makes you beautiful and natural. No one knows I've had anything done. They just say you never age!!! I highly recommend her for her talent, skills, professionalism and welcoming demeanor. She's the best!
Best treatment to help cure hangovers and ask for Maria she's the best with the needle and also very friendly! I will definitely be coming here again!
The best $3 you'll ever spend!! My absolute preferred method to get to Pearson Airport. It's fast and cheap
My favorite vistas and trails near Cave Creek!  And Not as heavily traveled as Pinnacle Peak.
Had a team lunch there, we were a group of 12 people. Good food. Staff is very courteous.  They have ample variety in sea food and in desserts. Overall a good place. May visit again.

My outside faucet(the one used for garden hose) was damaged and had to be replaced. I did a mistake and called Mr. Rooter. The technician came in an hour as they had promised, which was good. But he was very rude and pushy. He said I had a huge problem and if I don't fix it, my basement would be flooded and estimated the cost for fixing the problem to be $806 before taxes. Obviously, I wasn't going to pay that much for a small problem, so I called another company called ANTA plumbing. Even their technician arrived in an hour and was extremely professional and estimated $465 before taxes for the same problem.  He was kind enough to break down the cost for me. I've attached both the estimates that I received. You can see how Mr. Rooter wanted to steal from me.  I finally ended up calling a smaller company and had it done in $160. If you ever need a plumber, I highly recommend 'Action Plumbing'. Paul, was extremely professional, when I explained him the problem over the phone he gave me an estimate and did not over charge me after the problem was solved.   
So to conclude, if you want:
1. A rude and pushy technician
2. To pay around 7 times more
3. And want to hear an exaggerated version of the problem

PLEASE CALL MR. ROOTER, all other times 'Action Plumbing'.

Went on a weekday evening with friends. Restaurant wasn't busy. 
Food was okay. Rates aren't high and the quantities are reasonable. Taste is nothing extraordinary, like any other Hakka Chinese restaurant.  Service needs to improve. Staff wasnt very professional either. You are not missing anything if you haven't been here.

I visited Brar today for the first time with my family. We were told that we would have to wait for 40 mins but were given a table in around 25 mins which was impressive. The decor and ambience is appealing for an Indian buffet restaurant. 
I was pleasantly surprised when they clicked our picture and printed it for us as a family day gift.
We were served by 3 servers(as per name tags: Aman, Khushvir and Manpreet), all were quick and courteous. Would like if they interact more with the guests rather than just clearing plates. 
The food was average, nothing exciting. Ample options available for a veggie person. 
What I liked:
-Shahi Paneer: Was really delicious. Paneer was soft and fresh. 
-Fried rice: The fried rice had a nice schezuan flavor.  
-Pani Puri: Was mouth watering. One if the best that I've had in GTA. 
The dosa, chilli paneer and veg Manchurian could be a lot better. 

Another suggestion I have is to keep the plates at multiple locations instead of having it only near the soup section. 

Overall was impressed. Would give 5 stars if the food quality improved. Everything else was perfect.

Visited the 401-Dixie location on a weekday for a team lunch. I'm glad we had a reservation, this place gets busy. We were a group of 11 people and we enjoyed our time there. After we were seated our server(Sarah), introduced herself and took the drinks order. The drinks were served quickly and then another server came and took our orders for the food. This guy seemed more experienced. He really handled all the crazy requests very well. The food took really long to come out, which wasn't a surprise as they got the food for the entire table, out at the same time instead of bringing it out in batches. On our table, I ordered a veggie burger, it was a bit expensive($14) but tasted good and was huge in size, someone else ordered a chorizo flatbread and he was happy with it too. Another friend got the SmokeHouse Wrap and said it was a steal for that price. He absolutely loved it. 

Overall, good place to hangout with friends. Staff is very welcoming and also very attentive. Will certainly go back.

Visited on a sunday evening. Restaurant wasn't busy. Food was decent. Ambiance does not match with a south indian restaurant. Servers should probably get a uniform. Causal wear for the servers looks very unprofessional. It is hard to know if the person coming towards you is your  server or another customer. 
The service was good though. Servers were patient and courteous. Food came out on time and was good. 

Will visit again. Would be happy if they work on the ambiance and the uniforms for the servers though.

Have been visiting Velvet for few years now. If you decide to go for a haircut, make sure you book an  appointment with "Lewis". Very friendly, never in a rush and does an excellent job always. 

Remember to book an appointment before you go. Otherwise be ready to wait for a long time. Another thing to consider is, they don't accept Visa/Debit. They only accept cash.  

Would give 5 stars when they start accepting visa/debit.

If you want to have your dog groomed from a proffessional,  this is the place. Very friendly and accommodative staff. They are never in a rush to finish the grooming.  Always do more than what is expected. Overall a great place. Would recommend to all my friends.
If you want a dental office that seems more  like a spa, this is the place.
I asked for a deep tissue neck and shoulder massage, and that's exactly what I got.  Stephanie was wonderful.

Worst mistake of my life. Not only did they promise me the degree I got would help me change careers, but they stated they had job placement help and do NOT! I am now in debt, with a degree I can't use for much of anything and can't make a career change because the classes I wanted to take the 3 Academic counselors I had (they kept changing almost as much as the seasons) kept changing my classes. On top of that, 3 classes before graduation, the new academic advisor stated I was missing 3 classes and I had to add those on or I would get no degree! So I paid for 3 more classes that did NOTHING for me. I tried to switch schools but couldn't because I had to few classes left. I also had issues with NEVER hearing back from my financial advisor. Plus, horrible teachers, which I filed a complaint again and AFTER the class was completed was told the complaint was founded but there wasn't anything they could do. Though I struggled through the classes not because the material was that hard for me, but because the teachers were that bad and didn't know what they were teaching and I pointed out their inconsistances! Me, the student! 

I have been complaining now for over a year since I graduated and they keep "losing" my complaints and state I don't follow through with the complaint which is crap! I finally escalated to the higher level within UoP and gave them 7 business days from yesterday to meet my demands (which isn't much but it is what I feel would be fair) or I will take it to the government agencies and let them audit their butts!

Dr Martin receives 5 stars from me for bedside manner and overall expertise. I was in a mountain biking accident in Vail and suffered a broken left clavicle and extensive skin lacerations.  Upon my return, Dr Martin supervised my successful recovery. His entire staff was very knowledgable, friendly, and supportive (even when I may have been a little difficult to deal with). They were always available if I had an extra question or concern. Additionally, they were very flexible and were able to fit me in the schedule with very short notice. I would highly recommend Dr Martin and his staff's personalized medical care to help you in your recovery!

I took my second class on Sunday at Sweat Body Lounge. Not only are the instructors amazing, but the studio itself is the most beautiful studio I have ever been to. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. If you enjoy serene environments and exceptional yoga instructors, then you should go to Sweat. They also have separate men's and women's locker/changing areas (these have more of a spa changing room feel than a gym feel). This works out well for me because I can rinse off and get ready for work. By far the BEST yoga studio I have ever been to (and I have been to several across the country).
If you dont mind the pit boss changing the deck in the middle of a shoe than you will enjoy. Me personally I will never go back

My family always enjoys coming here. They have the perfect menu and great service. I have four kids between the ages six and twelve and they all love it here! We're not from around here, but this is our favourite place to eat.

Beware:  I ordered a replacement glass for a side table. They said it would be ready in 2-5 days. 2 weeks later still nothing. The guy said he would travk it down and call me back. No return call. On my third call back he threatened me with violence and said to come down to see what a man I was. This was followed by extremely harsh language and more threats.  I'm a fairly calm guy and not easily offended but I have never in my life come across anything like this.   Give this place a very big miss.  Single most aggressive evil unhinged service ever'!!  Needless to say I never got the glass. Still trying to get the owner on the phone

Dr. Sadre is fantastic. She pays attention to detail, is professional, and caring. I moved from out of state and was worried about finding a good dentist, but the staff immediately made me feel at home. They have even been able to squeeze me in for some dental emergencies. I recommend her to all my friends and would never go anywhere else.

They have amazing food. Our favorite are the desserts, especially the raw cheesecake. It's not just for vegetarians/ vegans - even my grandpa who eats meat everyday was loving the Philly melt......until we told him it wasn't beef :-)
Great breakfast. Good mimosas and bloody marys. The French toast and eggs Benedict with duck was delicious. The ambiance was good too. Sit on the pAtio.

Great club. Diverse crowd including age. Mature place where you don't have to worry about a shooting or "hood" crowd. Very sexy and sophisticated place. Free vodka drinks. Call early and put your name on the guest list to avoid lines. If you can spare a few hundred between friends get a table. It's so worth it.

I go to Brioche 1-2 times weekly, it's pretty close to my work and offers up a pretty decent latte, and really good lunch options.  Their Beet and Goat Cheese salad is amazing and actually quite filling.
3 stars because:
-the customer service is quite poor, no one is particularly friendly or helpful, a lot of the time one will direct you to another staff member, who will just stare at you until you talk
-the food is very pricey for the portion size
-the line-up area is very confusing; if you just go in for a coffee and go right up to the till, there's a moment of awkward limbo between you and a someone who is waiting for their food to be plated, but is ready to pay.
After visiting Paris last fall, it was neat to come home and see Brioche, as it is like 'the Starbucks of Paris'.  They do prepare the food almost in the exact same way, which was quite nostalgic.  Over all, very tasty, but could use a bit of work!

My dog has been groomed at Spaw a few times now, and every time we leave, she struts out the doors because she knows she looks good!  The staff at the new retail store are always really nice and helpful, you can tell they really love dogs.  My little furry gal is very finnicky, and they were able to help me find a treat that she loves- she actually waits for one every time we come in from a walk!  

She can be a difficult little lady to groom, I've never been able to do much more than brush her, but the groomers at Spaw have never voiced a complaint.  When I called to book her fist groom, I was disappointed that they day I originally wanted was booked up, but I was offered a Sunday appointment instead, which actually worked better with my schedule (it's so hard to find a weekend groomer!).  When I brought her in, I was able to meet with the groomer and go over exactly the cut I was looking for.  Initially, the cut I had asked for was better suited for a different type of dog (I brought in a picture I found online), but the groomer explained to me a better-suited 'hairstyle', and the end result was fantastic.  The couple grooms I've had since then have been with a different groomer (I think her name is Megan?), but the cut has been consistently bang-on.

I moved out of the Yonge and Eg area about 6 months ago, and have been itching to venture back, only to get a coffee from de Mello!  When I was living and working in the area, I would stop in several times a week, usually ordering a latte.  I tried a cappuccino once- best decision ever.  Perfectly made, perfect taste and texture.  When summer came, I tried their cold brew coffee- absolutely fantastic!  I love the lemon, a touch I would have never though of!  Anyone who is heading north, I always suggest they stop in.  There's nothing like it downtown!
Fabulous food. The mozzarella as you might expect was excellent with our appetizer of tomatoes, pesto, basil and rustic bread. The basic tomato, basil and buffalo mozzarella was perfect.

My new favorite place. Everything is delicious. Do yourself a favor and eat here ASAP. Had the BBQ  tri tip and it was one of the best thing I ever had. Also the service is amazing, Justin was a great waiter. If I was a inmate on death row ,this would be my last meal for sure.
Great shop and cool atmosphere . First time there, sure to be back. Good place for a classic cut and feel!

I love to come back here for the refreshing drinks and for the pizza, so far I've been here often enough and their pizza doesn't bother my stomach even with the cheese. I am hooked on the cucumber juice and also their variety on desserts...will need to go back again, it's been almost a year.
Love the busy and loud atmosphere, perfect for a weekend retreat. I always go for the chicken little, their veggie and salads are also great. The portions are enormous, you get what you pay for.
